title: Which gapps should I use with Exynos5420 Roms?
content: We recommend using nano opengapps. You can get the gapps from their [website](http://opengapps.org/)

title: Can you support device 'X'?
content: We need the device in order to support it as well as a device maintainer willing to maintain it.
If you can't find your device in our [download section](http://www.exynos5420.com/#/download) then it's not supported by us.
You can check your device's thread on xda-developers to see if someone built unofficial builds for your device.

title: I have a high battery drain with your Rom. What can I do?
content: In most cases, battery drain isn't caused by the Rom.
Occasionally, it can be caused by the first google sync just after configuring google account. or
by a badly coded or old app installed by the user.
Charge you device up to 100%, install better battery status (BBS) or similar app to closely monitor your device and check the reason for the drain.

title: Exynos5420 is not translated to my language, How can I help translating it?
content: You can help by Joining our [Crowdin Project.](https://crowdin.com/project/)
If you're unfamiliar with Crowdin check their [quick start guide](https://crowdin.com/page/quick-start) and choose I am a translator.

title: I really like Exynos5420 Roms, How can I contribute?
content: We're an open source project so if you have any coding experience you can make changes, add features, fix bugs and submit them to our [gerrit.](https://review.exynos5420.com/)
If you don't have any coding experience, You can help by sharing the word or [donating](https://goo.gl/ZZA2AT) to our project.
The donated money covers our server costs and gets us new devices to develop for and add to our officially supported devices

title: How can I be a device maintainer for 'X' device?
content: You have to have the device as we don't allow blind maintenance.
We also expect you to know your way around android and be able to fix problems as they emerge not just a builder.
If you meet the above requirement then you can contact us at teamexynos5420@gmail.com.
In your email, specifiy which device you want to maintain, link your work, **sources**, and specify why you think youâ€™d be a good addition to our team.
*PS: Work related to Exynos5420 devices or roms is preferable but not mandatory.*
